There are several types of cameras that can be used for astrophotography. Here are a few options:

1. DSLR or mirrorless camera: Many astrophotographers use DSLR or mirrorless cameras for capturing the night sky. These cameras offer interchangeable lenses, which is useful for capturing different types of objects and scenes. 2. Dedicated astrophotography camera: There are cameras designed specifically for astrophotography, such as the ZWO ASI, Atik Infinity, and QHYCCD. These cameras usually have larger sensors and are more sensitive to light than regular cameras, allowing for better performance in low light conditions. 3. Point & shoot camera: While not as versatile as DSLR or mirrorless cameras, point & shoot cameras can still capture decent images of the night sky. Some point & shoot cameras even have manual controls, which can be useful for adjusting settings like ISO and exposure time. Regardless of which type of camera you use, it's important to pay attention to things like lens aperture, ISO settings, and exposure time to get the best results. You may also want to consider investing in a sturdy tripod to keep your camera steady during long exposures. Good luck on your astrophotography journey!
